isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - VERIFICATION OF TIMING

svcproc.title: VERIFICATION OF TIMING
svcproc.para: Verify Injection Pump to Engine Timing as Follows, if Gear Train was Disassembled:

step1.para: Verify that the #1 piston is on the compression stroke by:

step2.para: Removing the valve cover/intake manifold assembly.
Check to see if the #1 cylinder intake and exhaust valve levers are loose by turning the push rods by hand.
If loose, the #1 piston is on the compression stroke and the injection pump may be removed.
If the #1 cylinder valve levers are NOT loose, set the pump to engine static timing as described in steps 2-4.

step1.para: Rotate the engine one complete revolution. The engine should now be on the #1 compression stroke.

Observe the engine front cover timing indicator and damper pulley degree alignment. Refer to Figure 11.6
.

svcproc.para: The engine should now be positioned at specified static pump to engine timing. Refer to Specifications.

note.para: If timing is not within specifications, rotate engine to correct crankshaft position (specified degrees before top dead center) before removing injection pump. If necessary to rotate engine in opposite direction of normal rotation to achieve specified timing, rotate engine to 90° before top dead center and then rotate engine to specified timing. This procedure takes up gear backlash.
